[p]``Switch on the magnoseals, 2-Tor,'' you order. A rainbow of light shimmers over the portal. Suddenly the androids hurl themselves at the walls. You duck.[/p] [p]``We won! What's happening to them?'' you ask 2-Tor.[/p] [p]``Magnetic distortion,'' he replies. ``1 shielded myself from the magnoseals, but they didn't.''[/p] [p]The portal computer speaks. ``Attention! You have sealed off your section! Detonation in thirty seconds. If danger is small, propel section into space. We will recover it later. If threat is great, please note your identification and explode section. Thank you.''[/p] [p]``Uh-oh,'' you say.[/p] [p]By this time the androids are standing again. They have reprogrammed to ward off magnetic interference, and they're aiming gravity charges at you.[/p] [p]``Destroy,'' the androids say together.[/p] [p]``Uh-oh!'' you say.[/p] [p]``Five seconds, boss,'' 2-Tor bleeps. His red lights flash wildly. ``What are we going to do?''[/p]
p.next: If you choose to propel the section into space
If you decide to explode the section

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/102.jpg" /][/p] [p]``Don't give up!'' You comfort the alien inventor. ``Maybe I can free you!''[/p] [p]``No!'' the alien shrieks. ``Destroy me!''[/p] [p]``Set micro-phasers to the max, 2-Tor,'' you order. A needle of light shoots from your micro-phaser and strikes a wire. The computer screams![/p] [p]``Did you pick up [em]that [/em]input?'' 2-Tor whirs.[/p] [p]The androids tear away from the computer and stalk toward you. The inventor is half-free, but the computer isn't giving up.[/p] [p]``Boss!'' 2-Tor cries. His red warning lights flash. The androids grab him. In milliseconds they will get you, too.[/p] [p]``Sorry about this,'' you tell the inventor. You wrench him free from the computer, and explosions rock the whole complex. The inventor's brain was the machine's database, and you have stolen it The androids drop like stones as the computer fizzles out.[/p] [p]With 2-Tor and the alien, you flee into space. The superplanet shudders as if it is going to blow up. Then all is quiet ``The Network of Worlds can settle people here now,'' you tell 2-Tor. ``When the computer stopped, it was the end of the android invasion.''[/p]
p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/104.jpg" /][/p] [p]``Did you see that?'' you exclaim. ``Where is that shuttle going? And how?''[/p] [p]``Insufficient data,'' 2-Tor replies. ``My computer can't answer that question. Perhaps the [em]Challenger [/em]would be of use?''[/p] [p]``Of course!'' You look at the sleek shuttlecraft in the next dock. ``The [em]Challenger[/em]'s computers can track the other shuttle.'' You both scramble onto the shuttlecraft[/p] [p]As soon as you enter, the hatch clicks shut The ship's hyperdrive engines start up. ``Oh, no!'' you say. ``The [em]Challenger [/em]is taking off, too!''[/p]
p.next: If you stay on the Challenger
If you want to get off the shuttlecraft

p.text: [p]``2-Tor,'' you say. ``They're androids. When you get my signal, take off.''[/p] [p]``We must report to Captain Polaris,'' the security head repeats. ``Lead us.''[/p] [p]``Sure,'' you say. You get in front of them. ``[em]Now![/em]'' you shout, and you and 2-Tor zoom down the corridor. The androids try to blast you, but you've gotten out of range.[/p] [p]``They'll follow us, 2-Tor,'' you say. ``What's up ahead?''[/p] [p]``[em]Challenger [/em]bay is on this level,'' 2-Tor beeps.[/p] [p]Seconds later you leap into the bay. It seals itself behind you. You slide breathlessly to the floor and sit there.[/p] [p]A shadow looms over you. ``Uh-oh, boss,'' 2-Tor says. ``I think we're in trouble.''[/p] [p]A ten-foot-tall android stands over you. Each of its fingers are micro-pulsers.[/p]
p.next: If you think you can try communicating with the android
If you decide to battle the android

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/107.jpg" /][/p] [p]You fire at the clones with a low-power pulserblast. ``Boss!'' 2-Tor bleeps. ``What are you doing? That blast wouldn't even stop me!''[/p] [p]``Up shields, Tor!'' The clones open fire. ``We need more power, and we'll get it from the clones. Deflect their blasts to the purple sea. Add all our power to the blast!''[/p] [p]``I get it,'' 2-Tor says. The energy glances off your shields. ``We hit the liquid at the right angle, with the right amount of power...''[/p] [p]The sea ripples under the force of your beam. It bubbles and throbs for a moment Then it gushes over the island in a giant wave. When the wave backs away the clones and androids are gone. Only the island remains.[/p] [p]``That clonedust had to be completely destroyed,'' you say. ``It could have infected the whole galaxy.''[/p] [p]``It won't now,'' 2-Tor says. Happy yellow lights flash on his chestplate. ``Thanks to us.''[/p]
p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p]``[em]Get away from Groot's daw![/em]'' you cry to 2-Tor. ``This way!'' You blast into the crevice. ``Anything is better than sitting out there.''[/p] [p]The only light in the crevice comes from the red warning lights on 2-Tor's chestplate. ``1 hope you're right, boss.'' He follows you into the cold gash in the rock. For long seconds you feel your way along the walls. The path is narrowing, but you can't turn back. Groot is somewhere behind you.[/p] [p]Then the walls of the crevice come together ahead of you. It's a dead end.[/p] [p]There isn't even time to turn around before Groot's jagged claws sweep down on you...[/p] [p class="end"]ZAP![/p]

[p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/109.jpg" /][/p] [p]``[em]We've got to persuade the androids to fight the Sam,[/em]'' you tell 2-Tor. ``[em]It's our only chance. Can you reach the androids with a communications link-up?[/em]''[/p] [p]``[em]It's possible, boss,[/em]''2-Tor says. ``[em]But...[/em]''[/p] [p]``[em]Then give me a linkup,[/em]'' you order. ``[em]We're running out of time.[/em]'' The Sam are raising their minds against you again. But your thoughts are now rousing the androids. One by one they leave the pods and march toward you.[/p] [p]``We have enough help to tear the Sam out by the roots,''you say. ``On to victory!''[/p] [p]Mechanical hands grab you suddenly and shove you to the ground. The androids crush the circuits of your bio-support suit You are helpless. They drag you to another pod. You can hear the Sarn say, ``You were foolish to thoughtcast your plan. We blocked your thoughts and kept control of the androids.''[/p] [p]Then the androids throw you into the pod. It won't be long before you're one of them, too.[/p] [p class="end"]ZAP![/p]

[p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/110.jpg" /][/p] [p]``[em]I'll try to grab a weapon,[/em]'' you thoughtcast to 2-Tor. ZAM! A destruct beam smashes you off your feet.[/p] [p]``[em]That's the end of our shield power,[/em]'' 2-Tor tells you. ``[em]If this doesn't work, we're dead.[/em]'' You hurl toward the floating weapons as forcebeams sizzle past you.[/p] [p]``The next blast will finish you,'' the android says. But your fingers brush a weapon. You spin and fire as the android unleashes its most powerful blast.[/p] [p]The android screams.[/p] [p]Fear glints in its cybernetic eyes. The weapon you hold sends the android's power back at it.[/p] [p]You hold the android's fate in your hands.[/p]
p.next: If you destroy the android
If you let the android continue to exist

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/112.jpg" /][/p] [p]``Show yourself,'' you shout to the android leader. ``I want to talk to you, coward.'' The aliens back away in terror as the hologram appears again.[/p] [p]``We have nothing to discuss, slave.''[/p] [p]``Sure we do,'' you reply. ``All you can do is sneakattack living beings. A fair fight would prove that we're better than androids.''[/p] [p]``Your words have logic,'' the android leader says. ``Androids must prove they are superior. We must crush the hopes of you creatures. We will battle.''[/p] [p]In a flash of light the android appears before you. It is wearing a battlesuit. ``Prepare to die, human.''[/p] [p]``You call this a fair fight?'' Suddenly your biosupport suit materializes around you.[/p] [p]``[em]You're taking a big risk, boss,[/em]'' 2-Tor thoughtcasts. ``[em]Your weapons are for defense, and that android is armed to destroy you. Don't count on warping away from danger. Your warper is shut down.[/em]''[/p] [p]``[em]I can handle it,[/em]'' you tell 2-Tor. But you aren't so sure. The android throws itself at you.[/p]

[p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc2/114.jpg" /][/p] [p]``We've got to find what's controlling those androids and put a stop to it. Can you trace those transmissions?'' you ask 2-Tor.[/p] [p]``Sure, boss,'' he replies. ``But you won't like it. Follow me.'' You orbit the planet. At last you spy a hole torn in the fabric of space. Strange forces shimmer inside it ``It's coming from in there,'' 2-Tor says.[/p] [p]You swoop toward the hole in space. Before you can reach it, a monstrous hand slaps you aside.[/p] [p]A three-headed monster guards the hole. Every one of its thousand teeth is as big as you are. ``None may pass Gigantus,'' the monster snarls. ``Stay on your side of the hole.''[/p] [p]``Let's turn back,'' 2-Tor bleeps. A rainbow of lights flashes on his chestplate.[/p] [p]``One thing's for sure,'' you reply. ``To get through the gate, we'll have to go through Gigantus.''[/p]
p.next: If you choose to battle Gigantus
If you want to turn back
